title: Zed ult should not reset CD if he doesn't finish animation b4 they die.

replies.body: Honestly just sounds like pure bad luck on Zed's part. The reason why it even has a cooldown reset to begin with is because it feels really bad to ult someone only for them to end up dying to your team before you can reach them. Then you become completely useless. Zed's ult already has plenty of counterplay, and there's plenty of times where you can use it by mistake and get punished for it by the ENEMY team; you shouldn't have to be punished for using it by your OWN team.
Pretty much this is why this argument is flawed in my opinion.

So because the Zed player will feel "really bad" for messing up his ult... He should get a reset on it? 

And use it by mistake and get punished for it? Well yea name any gap closing ults on any champion and if they use it by mistake the enemy team can quite possibly capitalize on it. 

And it has nothing to do with getting punished by your own team, you have your hands on the keyboard as the zed and if your team is killing someone and they have 10% left why are you ulting them? Its a waste regardless. But with the reset he gets a free immunity for a puny 5 sec CD.

in all honesty all ults that can be ksed should get resets like zeds ult caits ult syndras ult nocturn and vis ults i think they redid brands ult to change directions nautilus ult and veigars ults should atleast get cd reduction if stolen cuz lets be real your not gettin assists for these ults unless the part you need is done.it wouldnt punish people who play these champs if they get stupid teammates who take these kills before they are useful meaning more power for team fights instead of saying oh your this character? to bad shoulda gotten more attentive team mates sucks for you

I don't fully agree with you, the CD should only be refunded if the champion has a channel or a amount of time during which he cannot damage his target and the target dies from external damage during the channel, for exemple {{champion:51}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:238}} .
{{champion:134}} 's ult cast time is so brief that it's almost instantaneous, so it shouldn't be refunded.
{{champion:254}} 's ult should never reset because it can damage and knock aside champions when reaching for her target, rest would mean that you can damage and knock them aside twice if your initial target dies before she reaches it.
Not sure but I think {{champion:56}}'s ult will still move him to the target's corpse if it died while he's mid-dash, having a reset would allow him to cover a much greater distance.
So in the "cast time" of vis ult she can damage/knock aside champions. In the "cast time" of zeds, he is untargetable. Why should that get a reset?

I believe that the possibility of reset comes from whether your ult can fulfill its purpose or not :
{{champion:122}} 's ult : damage targeted champ
-> does nor reset if damage is applied
{{champion:51}} 's ult : damage an enemy champ (not necessarily targeted champ)
-> does not reset if bullet is fired
{{champion:254}} 's ult : damage and CC enemy champs (not only targeted champ)
-> never resets
{{champion:238}} 's ult : apply Death Mark to targeted champ
-> does not reset if Death Mark is applied

You have to accept that the brief moment of untargetability is not the main purpose of his ult. Again, I'm not saying that the current  way it resets is fine but I don't think it's possible to remove that entirely. It would severely hurt his gameplay and be a negative experience for the players.

Darius's is based on the Animation, not the damage. If you're up in the air and your blade starts it's arc down, about half way into the animation, it WON'T reset. You have to click them as some one dies to get the reset. Sometimes you'll get its passive proc the reset during the second half, even if you didn't actually kill them with it.
uh huh. good job. untargetability is too op for .75 seconds with no payoff because over half is damage comes from his ult
i can agree with you on syndra and i suppose vi and nocturns ults would also make sense since there both gap closers and cant really kill anyone unless quarter hp with full spell, well said points
You can potentially use just the invincibility to dodge even other ults. Of course it should go on CD.
and yet....  we have ekko, fizz, yi, and kalista and you think zed's ult is op because you become untargetable for 0.75 seconds
Well if you get rid of it for Zed you're gonna have to get rid of it for every other ability that does it too which consists of like half of the champion roster at least.

But sometimes your jungler comes to gank or something, you ult, but your target dies even before you place the mark. If the ult went on cd it would be annoying. But i agree they can abuse the cd reset

>
> But sometimes your jungler comes to gank or something, you ult, but your target dies even before you place the mark. If the ult went on cd it would be annoying. But i agree they can abuse the cd reset

thats the point, sometimes oriana's ball misses because of casting animation, so she may not even put out damage, even in the same situation, in the damage radius? target dies first? she cant cancel that ultimate and refund the CD, she still uses it.

but because you benefit from the immunity zeds ultimate gives, you might actually be staying alive longer than you should be in a team fight. 

so if you miss your damage portion on your ultimate, too bad.

> [{quoted}](name=CrestKnight,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AEucdy0g,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2015-08-28T11:19:56.741+0000)
>
> target dies first? she cant cancel that ultimate and refund the CD, she still uses it.


That's a delayed AoE ult. You can't compare that to Zed's ult. Tons of people can die before Ori's ult finishes casting, and it can still catch someone. There's literally zero need for it to reset just because it didn't kill anybody. Zed's ult resets because it has more than enough counterplay for the enemy team, there's no reason for it to also have counterplay from HIS OWN TEAM because they kill his target before he finishes casting his ult. Untargetability doesn't factor into this.

but what you aren't grasping here is that zed can use it to his advantage, ori actually roots herself to use the ultimate for the chance* that they dont just flash out or use their escape tool in the .25seconds. 

im not saying just because he doesn't land on the target you shouldn't have an ultimate at all, you still gain up to 3 seconds of invulnerability from pressing R. and if the target dies you can have more than 3 seconds of untargetability, and you can abuse it because "if you get caught out" you stay alive longer, and your team comes in blasts the CC threat thats on top of you and you can do it again on the proper target whom you do mean to damage/burst into the ground. 

THATS unnecessary.

why should you get a second chance while others dont? you already have a below average CD on the ultimate making it available in any team fight or on any roam. 

in addition you have to deliberately choose a target and press R, if you make a mistake, that should be your fault and put the ult on CD like any other champion.

> you still gain up to 3 seconds of invulnerability from pressing R

You know the invulnerability is only 0.75sec, right ?

you do know its not just his R thats the problem, its his entire kit of dashing back and forth instantly, good luck mousing over him. 

his real cancer is his laning phase, how incredibly safe and aggressive he can be thanks to infinite resource.
so you want him to be that one assasin that stands in one place?

good idea. lets also get rid of his ad scalings and energy, to make him unable to lane, easy to get focused down and killed, and take away the thing that allows him to do anything in a fight. good idea

Same can be said for a Braum ult that doesn't hit the caitlyn before Kha nukes her. Just because it wiffs doesn't mean they shouldn't deal with the consequences.

Besides, a minor annoyance to Zed for the sake of consistency? Heh, what I'd give to live in that world...

While you do have a point concerning Zed possibly becoming untargetable multiple times, it's still very unlikely to happen since each target would have to die in a 0.75sec window. Also, having your ult reset can be detrimental since Zed will reappear at the original location. Putting the full CD after this happen seems too harsh, however it could be put on a longer reduced cooldown (like 10 seconds instead of 5).

Also, for the sake of comparison, the only similar ults I can think of (targeted with some kind of channel before) are {{champion:51}}  (5secs CD + mana not refunded) and {{champion:122}} (does not go on CD + no mana consumed).

How about when a caitlyn ults and the bullet is on the way, but the person dies before hand.. That cait feels like a derp but who cares? shouldnt have ulted. Thats more similar to this then the actual channel she does, because zed closes the gap, becomes untargetable and then o wait i shouldnt have ulted someone at 10% its ok though reset.

And im not talking about the likelihood of him resetting it 5 times, but i actually saw him ult 3 times and i swear it totally changed the fight.

When the bullet is fired, it will reach the target's corpse and then disappear. However, it can still be intercepted by other champions so her ult isn't completely nullified. In Zed's case, his ult would basically become a teleport back to his original location (on a 0.5sec CD) : no possible damage at all. It makes sense to me that he gets a reset but like I said, it would be more healthy with a slightly longer CD than the current one (5sec).
